context: the patient is a 9-year-old caucasian male with history of recurrent episodes of adenotonsillitis that has been refractory to outpatient antibiotic therapy.

the patient is a 9-year-old caucasian male with history of recurrent episodes of adenotonsillitis that has been refractory to outpatient antibiotic therapy.

postoperative diagnosis:
chronic adenotonsillitis.

procedure performed:
tonsillectomy and adenoidectomy.

anesthesia:
general endotracheal tube.

estimated blood loss:
minimum, less than 5 cc.
specimens:right and left tonsils 2+, adenoid pad 1+. there was no adenoid specimen.
specimens:right and left tonsils 2+, adenoid pad 1+. there was no adenoid specimen.
specimens:right and left tonsils 2+, adenoid pad 1+. there was no adenoid specimen.

text: four to five episodes of adenotonsillitis per year
context: the patient has had approximately four to five episodes of adenotonsillitis per year for the last three to four years.
he was placed in a supine position.
the mcivor mouth gag was carefully positioned into the patient's mouth with attention to avoid the teeth.
the adenoid pad was then visualized with a laryngeal mirror. the adenoids appeared to be 1+ and non-obstructing.
there was no evidence of submucosal cleft palate palpable.
there was no evidence of bifid uvula.

a curved allis clamp was then used to grasp the superior pole of the right tonsil. the tonsil was then retracted inferiorly and medially. bovie cautery was used to make an incision on the mucosa of the right anterior tonsillar pillar to find the appropriate plane of dissection.
suction cautery was then used to adequately obtain hemostasis with the tonsillar fossa.
the tonsil was then dissected out within this plane using a bovie.
suction cautery was then used to adequately obtain hemostasis with the tonsillar fossa.

text: adenoid pad was 1+ and was non-obstructing
context: after adequate hemostasis was obtained, attention was directed towards the adenoid pad. the adenoid pad was again visualized and appeared 1+ and was non-obstructing.
using a laryngeal mirror under direct visualization, the adenoid pad was then cauterized with care to avoid the eustachian tube orifices as well as the soft palate and inferior turbinates.
final look revealed no evidence of further bleeding and 10 mg of decadron was given intraoperatively.
